name: Zirconium
educationalNotes: Zirconium is used in nuclear reactor fuel cladding - resists radiation damage! Zirconia (zirconium oxide) is artificial diamond substitute in jewelry - chemically inert and brilliant. Zircon gemstone contains zirconium silicate (beautiful blue/golden/colorless). High melting point (2,128°C) makes it suitable for refractory ceramics. Zirconium aluminide coatings protect aircraft engines from heat. Discovered in 1789. Nuclear-grade zirconium must be >99.99% pure.
